titleStmt.title: A plea for free-mens liberties: or The monopoly of the Eastland marchants anatomized by divers arguments (wch will also serve to set forth the unjustnesse of the marchant-adventurers monopoly,) and proved illegall, unnaturall, irrationall, against the honour of the nation, tending to its ruine and vassalage, procured by evill counsellors: and lastly treasonable: with a short comment upon their oath, worthy of every mans serious perusall. / Penned for the publique good, by Thomas Johnson marchant.
titleStmt.author: Johnson, Thomas, marchant.

titleStmt.title: A plea for free-mens liberties: or The monopoly of the Eastland marchants anatomized by divers arguments (wch will also serve to set forth the unjustnesse of the marchant-adventurers monopoly,) and proved illegall, unnaturall, irrationall, against the honour of the nation, tending to its ruine and vassalage, procured by evill counsellors: and lastly treasonable: with a short comment upon their oath, worthy of every mans serious perusall. / Penned for the publique good, by Thomas Johnson marchant.
titleStmt.author: Johnson, Thomas, marchant.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed Anno 1646. and are to be sold in London, at every stationers shop, that loves liberty, and hates monopolies,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 26 1645"; the second 6 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
